content: @docwilmot and I are going to sprint this Sunday from 12:00 - 3:00pm (Pacific Time) to get ready for Backdrop CMS 1.16.0. We need some folks able to help with code reviews.
I think we'll open a Zoom room for those who want to hang out together.
We have a bunch of issues that are almost RTBC, but need code reviews and there is no point waiting until the last 24 hours.
I'm planning to join :slight_smile:

Quick note. I wasn't thinking about Easter when I suggested that we sprint this Sunday (later today). However, I suppose this isn't the average Easter and it may not matter to most of us. Personally, I still plan on sprinting.
its $4000 +/- 6 months in jail if I'm caught away from my house tomorrow. So I'll be home.

That's pretty tough.

:-(

Well, I'll see you online.

It's interesting how different jurisdictions are managing a lockdown. Here in Canada businesses and individuals can be fined for certain things but I can still travel. Parks are closed, most stores have to either doing curbside pickup, or delivery, except for grocery stores
I haven't heard of many people getting fined. Maybe the dumb ones still holding parties
I will be late, but I am coming this afternoon. Will open a zoom room late, if no one beats me to it.
what pacific time is it now? is it time for sprinting?

StPaulTim said:

docwilmot and I are going to sprint this Sunday from 12:00 - 3:00pm (Pacific Time) to get ready for Backdrop CMS 1.16.0. We need some folks able to help with code reviews.

OK. Tim had said 3pm my time but he got that wrong. Should have started 47 mins ago I guess.
Sorry, I'm here now. The time was right, but something came up with my parents. They wanted to go for a drive and it took longer than expected.
I'm going to open the Zoom room in case anyone wants to talk.
:slight_smile: Its only 2.53 here now tho. So thought I still had 7 mins before start
zoom away
Well, the sprint happens whenever we show up. So, you right.
My original post said 12:00 - 3:00 Pacific Time and it's almost 1:00 Pacific Time now.

I'm around too :wave: ...been working on #4197 these couple of days. Really close to a final PR now :slight_smile:

[UX] Add configuration to exclude node types from search indexing · Issue #4197 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need Here is the excerpt from https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/search_index_options: The core search module scans all the available content, regardless of whether some content...

I have opened up our usual Zoom room - http://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings

I have my camera off, but audio is on in case anyone wants to drop in.

Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference room solution used around the world in board, conference, huddle, and training rooms, as well as executive offices and classrooms. Founded in 2011, Zoom helps businesses and organizations bring their teams together in a frictionless environment to get more done. Zoom is a publicly traded company headquartered in San Jose, CA.

I'm on https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4354

[D8][WP][UX] Forward Revisions · Issue #4354 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Because issue #1475 has drifted from it's original intention and gone through so many changes/discussion, we decided to close that issue and open two new issues - including this one. Descriptio...
@docwilmot , @klonos and I are in the Zoom room.
Nice discussion. We made some nice progress on Forward Revisions.
@docwilmot - I think it would be helpful if someone documented the questions we talked about (Forward Revisions) today and what we decided, in case this comes up again later.
You might remember the conversation better, but if it would be helpful, I could try.
Will do
And add that as a comment in the issue?
